Flash Gordon.Action: Grins and obliges co-pilot's request for an autograph for his kid.
Offers candy to Dale to help with her nervousness.
Makes light comments about turbulence and training camp timing.
Suggests pilots change altitude during turbulence, despite their focus.
Offers candy to Dale to help with her nervousness.
Responds briefly and somewhat dismissively to Dale's comments about his fame and salary.
Responds confidently and casually to Dale's teasing about his fame and salary with a simple 'Of course.'
Does not react with panic or confusion when Dale expresses fear about flying and notices strange phenomena outside the plane.
Remains silent and speechless along with Dale when the sun turns blood red and clouds race unnaturally, showing no immediate action or explanation.
Unsaps his belt, leaps up and races forward to take control of the plane after pilots vanish.
Encourages Dale to help him pull up the plane, showing teamwork and reliance on others.
Unsaps his belt, leaps up, races forward to the cockpit, scrambles into the pilot seat, fights the controls, and commands Dale to help pull the plane up during a dive.
Admits he has only had a couple of flying lessons and is unsure if he can land the plane.
Commands to brace and aims the plane skillfully at the field despite incoming red lightning bolts.
Immediately checks on Dale's wellbeing after crash, shows concern.
Helps Dale out of the wreckage and assists with emergency exit.
Introduces himself and Dale politely to Zarkov, engages in friendly conversation.
Struggles from his seat despite being dazed and injured, immediately checks on Dale's condition, and helps her escape through the emergency exit.
Quickly assesses the dangerous situation and suggests leaving before the plane explodes.
Introduces himself and Dale to Zarkov and calmly asks to use a phone despite the stressful situation.
Whispers encouragement to Dale as they run from danger, trying to keep her calm.
Expresses skepticism by calling Zarkov insane, but does not abandon or insult him harshly.
Recognizes the urgency of the situation and follows Zarkov's lead despite initial bafflement.
Advises Dale to 'go with the flow' and wait for a chance while escaping danger.
Initially calls Zarkov insane, showing skepticism in a high-pressure moment.
Leaps after Dale into the capsule to protect her despite danger.
Fights Zarkov to regain control of the capsule, showing protective and decisive behavior.
Folds his arms around Dale protectively during the increasing centrifugal force.
Leaps after Dale into the capsule despite danger, showing readiness to act decisively.
Engages in a physical struggle with Zarkov, attempting to control the situation.
Protects Dale by folding his arms around her during the increasing centrifugal force, showing presence of mind and protective instinct.
Staggers to his feet and protects Dale despite extreme centrifugal force and laser fire.
Endures intense physical strain and danger without losing composure or abandoning companions.
Maintains hold of Dale while semi-conscious during a dangerous descent, showing physical control and protective instinct.
No direct control over the capsule's flight path is shown; the capsule changes course miraculously without apparent intervention.
Approaches alien leader with a warm grin and extends his hand in friendship.
Greets the alien leader sincerely and identifies himself as a friend from Earth.
Does not react with hostility or aggression when immediately captured and manacled.
Approaches the alien leader confidently and attempts to communicate peacefully by introducing himself and offering a handshake as a gesture of friendship.
Fails to anticipate the hostile reaction and is quickly captured and manacled, showing a lack of caution or strategic foresight in a dangerous unknown situation.
Despite being captured, maintains a sense of humor and acknowledges the mistake with a lighthearted comment to Zarkov, indicating resilience and quick thinking under pressure.
Engages with Dale, showing concern and attention to her distress.
Does not intervene or react to the torment of the beast and the death of the man nearby.
Questions Dale about shutting her eyes instead of following her example or taking action.
Expresses concern about how to escape the dangerous situation, showing protective instincts.
Threatens Dr. Zarkov in frustration, showing impatience and aggression.
Questions Zarkov about how to get out of a dangerous situation, showing concern and seeking solutions.
Threatens Zarkov impulsively instead of calmly assessing the situation.
Swallows nervously but maintains composure when confronted by Princess Aura's bold gaze.
Introduces companions Dale Arden and Dr. Zarkov, showing loyalty and trust.
Allows Dale to warn him about his distraction, showing receptiveness and respect.
Maintains composure and introduces himself confidently before a hostile ruler, despite the threatening atmosphere and distractions.
Is visibly distracted and affected by Princess Aura's provocative presence, requiring a reminder from Dale to stay focused.
Questions Ming about why Earth is being targeted, showing concern and seeking understanding.
Tenses and prepares to spring when Ming touches Dale, showing protective instincts.
Questions Ming boldly about his motives despite the danger.
Remains tense and ready to spring when Dale is being manipulated.
Does not intervene immediately when Dale is drawn forward by Ming's power.
Insists on staying together with Zarkov despite danger, shows protective loyalty.
Starts to defend Dale against the hooded guard.
Warns Dale about approaching guards, acts to protect her.
Hesitates to fight the Amazons because they are women.
Eventually overcomes hesitation and fights to protect Dale.
Flies at three hooded guards, quickly disables all three using skillful combat and weapon use.
Stands in front of Dale with raised mace, ready to defend her.
Is momentarily paralyzed and indecisive when confronted by the Amazons, unable to act immediately.
Overcomes paralysis and decisively attacks the nearest pair of Amazons.
Fights desperately to free himself and chase after Dale when she is captured, showing concern and determination to protect her.
Struggles physically but does not give up despite being overwhelmed, indicating loyalty and protective instincts.
Fights fiercely despite being outnumbered and pinned down by a dozen Amazons.
Summons adrenaline and makes a superhuman effort to break free and pursue Dale.
Falls through a trap door unexpectedly, losing physical control of the situation.
Seizes Aura's ankle as directed and follows her lead to escape danger.
Expresses gratitude to Aura for saving his life.
Seizes Aura's ankle as directed and follows her lead underwater, showing quick adaptation and trust in guidance.
Staggers and collapses on the beach after emerging from water, showing physical exhaustion but recovers to continue.
Openly states his goal to rescue Dale and Zarkov and save Earth, showing sincerity and commitment.
Admits he is no good at lying when confronted by Aura.
Clearly states his priorities and mission: to find Dale and Zarkov, rescue them, and save Earth.
Admits he is no good at lying when confronted by Aura.
Stops to carefully observe the plasma cavern and the situation of the slaves, showing awareness and attention to detail.
Follows Aura despite the danger, showing trust and cooperation.
Follows Aura cautiously despite the danger, showing awareness of the risk of being spotted and killed.
Looks at Aura and then back into the window, reacting to the situation, indicating alertness and situational awareness.
Seizes Aura by the shoulders, asks about Dale Arden with concern.
Expresses doubt about trusting Aura but ultimately follows her lead.
Admits he can't fly a rocket ship but is willing to learn.
Seizes Aura by the shoulders and questions her about Dale, showing initiative and concern.
Expresses doubt about his ability to fly a rocket ship, admitting he can't fly one.
Listens to Aura and agrees to trust her despite uncertainty.
No direct action or statement by Flash Gordon in this excerpt to evaluate competence.
Shivers at the mention of Bear Men who eat their own young, showing sensitivity to others' suffering.
Does not respond to Dale's call for help, leading to her despair.
Gazes down at the glittering sight and follows Aura's instructions to pilot the spacecraft using unfamiliar controls.
Shivers as patches of frost and ice start to form on the craft's bubble, indicating some discomfort or vulnerability in the situation.
Expresses curiosity about the inhabitants of the moon and their situation.
Questions why the hostile kingdoms don't unite against their common enemy.
Shakes his head at Aura's confusion about the concept of a 'team', showing patience.
Pleads with Aura to teach him telepathic communication, showing openness and friendly engagement.
Suddenly moves the craft into a violent dive, causing Aura to yell.
Moves his hands over the control panel to pull up and bank the craft around the moon.
Asks why the hostile moons don't team up to fight Ming, showing strategic thinking.
Shows a thoughtful look, indicating active problem-solving and consideration.
Shakes his head when Aura doesn't understand the concept of a team, showing awareness of social dynamics.
Suddenly moves his hands sharply over the control panel causing the craft to dive violently, which causes Aura to yell.
Seizes Aura's wrists firmly to take control of the craft despite her protests, insisting on his plan to reach Dale Arden.
Seizes Aura's wrists firmly to take control of the craft and dive toward Ardentia despite her protests, showing decisiveness and confidence in a high-stakes situation.
Commands Aura to put a gadget on his head to tune in to Dale Arden, indicating strategic thinking and use of technology to achieve his goal.
Reassures Dale through thought transference that he is with her and they are connected.
Expresses excitement and encouragement to Dale to think of him hard, maintaining their connection.
Dismisses Aura's significance to him despite her being Ming's daughter, showing loyalty to Dale.
Uses the Thought Transference gizmo to communicate telepathically with Dale, concentrating fiercely and maintaining focus.
Confidently reassures Dale that he is with her and they are connected despite the unusual circumstances.
Plans to speed to the Kingdom of Arboria to get help, showing strategic thinking and initiative.
Expresses deep concern and affection for Dale, encouraging her and promising to find her and help her escape.
Shows sincere emotional vulnerability by choking up and openly expressing longing and care for Dale.
Encourages Dale to use deception to escape and promises to find her and help, showing quick thinking and confidence under pressure.
Appears dazed and dreamy, needing to be snapped out of it by Aura, indicating a momentary lapse in focus.
Recovers quickly after a rough landing and apologizes lightheartedly to Aura.
Offers a hand to Aura to help her out of the shuttle.
Asks Aura a question about 'Robin Hood' but quickly dismisses it when she doesn't know, showing no impatience.
Recovers quickly after a rough landing that nearly throws him and Aura against their seat belts.
Admits that landings aren't his strong suit, showing self-awareness but also a limitation.
Struggles out of the shuttle and helps Aura up, then quickly assesses the surroundings and asks a relevant question about their next move.
Asks 'Where's Robin Hood?' which seems out of place or irrelevant, then dismisses it, indicating some confusion or distraction.
Pauses and expresses doubt about Barin's help, showing openness and vulnerability.
Gazes wistfully at the tree-house he dreamed of as a kid, showing sincerity and a gentle side.
Pauses to question Aura about trusting Barin, showing caution and thoughtfulness.
Gazes wistfully at the tree-house he dreamed of as a kid, showing a moment of distraction or sentimentality.
Questions the loyalty and effectiveness of the allies, showing concern and skepticism.
Stands beside Aura, attentive to her and the situation, indicating trust and camaraderie.
Questions the loyalty and effectiveness of the Tree Men who are supposed to help him, showing awareness and critical thinking.
Does not take direct action in this excerpt, mostly observing and reacting to others' movements.
Watches the fight with Aura, makes a lighthearted comment comparing Tiger Man's rage to a football game.
Hesitates when Aura tells him to go inside and let her talk to Barin first.
Makes a lighthearted, confident comment about understanding Tiger Man's rage by comparing it to a tough football game.
Hesitates when Aura urges him to go inside and let her talk to Barin first.
Steps out calmly to face Barin and explains his situation honestly.
Expresses shock and hurt when Aura reveals she wants to keep him for herself, indicating trust and sincerity.
Steps out confidently to confront Prince Barin and explains his situation clearly.
Is stunned and betrayed upon realizing Aura's intentions to keep him captive.
States 'I'm not your enemy, Prince Barin. We share a hatred of Ming.'
Watches the snake keeper with horrified revulsion.
Attempts to reason with Prince Barin by stating they share a common enemy, Ming.
Shows horrified revulsion watching the snake keeper handle the venomous serpent.
Expresses concern for Dale and asks Aura to deliver a message apologizing and expressing love.
Acknowledges the futility of sending a message through Aura with a dismissive comment.
Faces a deadly challenge bravely, showing resolve under pressure.
Refuses to blindly take a deadly risk by declining to plunge his hand into the snake holes initially, showing caution and awareness.
Calmly assesses the situation, looks at the stump, Barin, Aura, and even tries to send a message to Dale, showing presence of mind under pressure.
Despite the threat of death, he chooses to act decisively by plunging his hand into one of the holes with a sudden quick motion, demonstrating courage and confidence.
Momentarily distracted by personal emotions and a message to Dale before acting, which could be seen as a hesitation or emotional vulnerability in a critical moment.
Encourages Prince Barin to take his turn, showing friendly challenge and engagement.
Teases Barin by saying 'Boy. You oughta be handled with a forked stick yourself.'
Plays the game with good humor and courage despite danger, showing trustworthiness and sincerity.
Plunges his hand into a hole potentially containing a serpent multiple times, showing quick reflexes and courage.
Uses a silent 'eeny-meeny-miney-mo' to choose between the last two holes, indicating reliance on chance rather than strategy.
Despite the danger, manages to grasp the serpent just below the head, demonstrating skill and presence of mind.
Leaps into action to protect others from the serpent, fights to defend Barin and the group.
Frees the Tiger Man from a net despite the danger, enabling him to fight alongside.
Grasps the terrible serpent just below the head despite its danger.
Uses the serpent as a weapon by swinging it at enemies and slamming its head into a post.
Snatches the sword from the serpent's tail before it hits the floor after it was ripped from Barin's hand.
Freed the Tiger Man by slashing the cords of the net, enabling an ally to fight alongside him.
Trips over a vine while running through the forest.
Asks Tiger Man if they have a chance, showing concern and engagement.
Snatches crossbow from Tiger Man and acts decisively to protect both of them.
Quickly assesses the situation and uses a crossbow with a glass arrow to shoot an armed enemy in a moving basket, showing skill and decisiveness.
Expresses frustration at the end of the tree branches but quickly adapts by noticing the elevator vine and planning an action.
Acts decisively and courageously under threat, aiming and firing an arrow to protect himself and Tiger Man.
Considers surrendering by making a motion to throw down his weapon but then chooses to fight instead.
Jumps into the basket as it passes by, showing quick reflexes and decisiveness.
Identifies the color change in the light above as blue, demonstrating awareness and observational skill.
Feigns surrender by making like to throw down his weapon but instead fires his crossbow at the last instant, showing tactical cunning and quick thinking.
Laughs aloud and enjoys the sensation of bouncing on leaves, showing a lighthearted and friendly demeanor.
Struggles vainly against the tendril's strength while being rescued by Tiger Man.
Suggests teaming up with Barin to overthrow Ming instead of continuing to kill each other.
Fights desperately against the flower's deadly closing petals and spikes, showing physical courage and resistance.
Engages Barin in dialogue proposing an alliance to overthrow Ming, demonstrating strategic thinking and leadership.
Relies on Barin's intervention to be saved rather than escaping on his own.
Is the subject of a rescue mission, implying others are acting to save him rather than him acting competently in this excerpt.
Is escorted by hawkmen through space, implying he is a significant figure worthy of guarded transport.
Does not resist or attempt escape while being carried by hawkmen, showing passivity in this moment.
Survives being dropped hard onto a terrace and quickly lifts his head groggily, showing awareness despite the impact.
Is carried and dropped by Hawkmen rather than moving independently, indicating a momentary lack of control or vulnerability.
Immediately reacts to Dale's scream and dives to catch her as she falls, saving her life.
Embraces Dale warmly and reassures her sincerely.
Proposes teaming up with others to fight a common enemy, showing trust and cooperation.
Bounds to his feet and dives to catch Dale as she falls from the terrace, preventing her from hitting the ground.
Immediately proposes teaming up with Vultan and others to fight Ming, showing strategic thinking and leadership.
Admits to having to face a challenge despite bitterness, showing acceptance of difficult circumstances.
Mentions he could have killed Barin when he had the chance, indicating a readiness for violence.
Responds to Barin's threat with a blunt, somewhat sarcastic remark ('Oh god -- here we go again --').
Confidently asserts his leadership and past achievements despite language barriers and hostile environment.
Engages in tense verbal sparring with Barin, showing awareness of danger and readiness to fight.
Accepts the challenge to the joust despite apparent risks, showing resolve but possibly lack of strategic avoidance.
Squeezes Dale's hand to offer comfort despite the dangerous situation.
Stops short, eyes popping, upon seeing the razor sharp knives popping up on the disc, indicating alertness and quick perception of danger.
Asks Barin to swear to join Vultan against Ming if defeated, showing concern for Aura's safety.
Responds to Dale's encouragement with renewed effort, showing connection and motivation from her support.
Almost slips and falls immediately upon stepping onto the disc.
Gets his balance again quickly after nearly falling.
Engages Barin in a whip fight on a dangerous, tilting, knife-studded disc, showing poise and readiness.
Despite Barin gaining the upper hand and driving him back, Flash summons adrenaline and fights back aggressively.
Uses a superhuman effort to flip Barin over the edge of the disc.
Immediately dives onto his side amidst deadly knives to grab Barin's wrist, showing quick reflexes and presence of mind.
Grasps Barin's wrist to save him from falling into the abyss, instructs him to try to catch his other wrist and swing his body to get a leg up.
Endures a dangerous situation to save an enemy (Barin) despite threats from Vultan and Ming.
Flips Barin over his back with a superhuman effort and catches him hanging over the abyss, holding his wrist to save him.
Commands Barin to swing his body to get a leg up, showing quick thinking and leadership in a dangerous situation.
Tiger Man helps Flash pull Barin up to safety.
Is pulled to safety by Tiger Man while in danger, showing reliance on allies rather than solo action.
Participates actively in the flight with Hawkpeople alongside leaders and allies, indicating readiness and involvement in coordinated action.
Gazes at Dale lovingly and speaks to her with affection despite the presence of others.
Immediately responds to Dale's distress by calling out to her and ordering his Hawkmen to follow and climb to help her.
Immediately responds to Dale's distress call and commands his Hawkmen to follow and climb after her.
Engages in lighthearted banter with Dale while in a dangerous situation, showing confidence and calmness.
Lets Vultan go after he refuses to participate in a suicidal plan, showing understanding.
Participates actively in a military staff meeting, reviewing maps and plans with allies, showing strategic involvement.
Calmly accepts Vultan's refusal to participate in a dangerous plan, showing emotional intelligence and leadership restraint.
Tells Zarkov to get out of his way so he can move while invisible, showing directness but also cooperation.
Follows Zarkov's instructions precisely during the invisibility test, showing readiness and discipline.
Communicates clearly despite being invisible and trapped, indicating presence of mind and problem-solving.
Does not panic or fail to respond when Zarkov calls him, maintaining composure.
His Hawkman dropped him; presumed dead after falling into glaciers.
Moves quickly and alone toward the capsule to take off, showing determination but no direct interaction with others in this excerpt.
Moves quickly and stealthily to enter the capsule and initiate takeoff alone, showing decisiveness and control.
Addresses Vultan in a friendly, informal manner, calling him 'you crazy ole bird' and expressing hope to see him again.
Stops in dismay and lets out a bitter sigh when Zarkov's capsule is destroyed, showing concern and emotional response.
Guides Vultan through the force-field under enemy control, communicates precise instructions over radio, and remains calm under pressure.
Allows himself to be detected and attacked by enemy ray gun, resulting in his capsule being destroyed.
Uses invisibility and physical force to incapacitate soldiers and guards without lethal intent, aiming to rescue allies.
Intimidates soldiers by creating a fearsome shadow and threatening them as the 'ghost of all the good men murdered by Ming'.
Uses invisibility and stealth to incapacitate multiple enemies efficiently and without being detected.
Creates a fearsome shadow to intimidate soldiers, causing them to faint.
Asks a soldier for directions to the dungeons, showing situational awareness and gathering intelligence.
Leads a difficult climb up a narrow vertical shaft with others, including an invisible partner, showing physical skill and determination.
Demonstrates knowledge of the anti-gravity shaft and uses insider information from a guard to plan the route.
Acknowledges the difficulty of the task but remains confident and resolute.
Enters invisibly to gather intelligence and reports the cavern is sealed tight, showing concern for the group's dire situation.
Does not display any dismissive or self-centered behavior in this excerpt; remains focused on the group's survival.
Enters the sealed cavern invisibly and reports that every door is locked from the inside, indicating careful reconnaissance and stealth.
Despite the dire situation and Zarkov's loss of hope, Flash continues to act and provide information, showing resilience and presence of mind.
Clasping Vultan's hand invisibly to save him from an attack, intervening skillfully in battle.
Urgently commands to get Zarkov into the cavern to help, showing concern for his ally's involvement.
Commands to focus on the cavern first and get Zarkov involved, showing strategic prioritization under pressure.
Interrupts the forced wedding ceremony by reciting the vow and preventing the ring from being placed by Ming.
Interrupts the forced wedding ceremony by snatching the ring from Ming's grip and placing it on Dale's finger, acting decisively and with confidence.
Commands Dale to run to safety during chaos.
Intervenes invisibly to protect others by confronting Ming with a sword.
Pauses to look at himself while losing invisibility, almost gets his head lopped off by Ming's fiery slash but recovers quickly and bounds up higher to continue the battle.
Seizes the instant to strike at Ming, effectively ending the threat.
Seizes the instant during a critical moment and thrusts his sword into Ming, effectively eliminating him.
Stands with sword atop statue, receiving cheers from Mongons.
Puts arm around Dale's shoulder tenderly and shows concern for her feelings.
Kisses Dale and shares a moment of affection.
Stands confidently atop the statue with his sword, receiving the hail of the Mongons.
Comforts Dale tenderly and responds calmly to the loss of the capsule, accepting their new reality with Zarkov's reassurance.
